instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the performance in the diagnostic system for melanoma, and how far can this metric go?

The metric chosen to evaluate the performance of the diagnostic system for melanoma using hyperspectral data (HSD) and a convolutional neural network is sensitivity, specificity, and accuracy. The sensitivity measures the proportion of true positive results, the specificity measures the proportion of true negative results, and the accuracy measures the overall correctness of the system's predictions.

The results of the evaluation indicate a sensitivity of 69.1% without data augmentation and 72.3% with data augmentation. The specificity is 75.7% without data augmentation and 81.2% with data augmentation. The accuracy is 72.7% without data augmentation and 77.2% with data augmentation.

Based on these results, the diagnostic system shows moderate performance in correctly identifying melanoma lesions.
